meanings.definition: Play with or manipulate (something) as if it were a toy.
meanings.sent1: The child toyed with the colorful blocks, stacking them up and knocking them down.
meanings.sent2: She toyed with the idea of starting a new hobby but never took action.
meanings.sent3: The cat toyed with the mouse, pretending to pounce but letting it escape each time.
meanings.sent4: His mind toyed with the possibilities of what could happen if he took the risk.
meanings.sent5: The wind toyed with the leaves, swirling them around in a dance.

meanings.definition: Treat something casually or without seriousness.
meanings.sent1: He toyed with the idea of skipping work and going to the beach instead.
meanings.sent2: She toyed with the food on her plate, not really hungry but eating out of habit.
meanings.sent3: The student toyed with the thought of not studying for the test, but then decided against it.
meanings.sent4: The company toyed with the idea of changing their logo but ultimately kept it the same.
meanings.sent5: The dog toyed with the idea of chasing the squirrel but got distracted by a butterfly instead.

meanings.definition: Tease or play with someone in a flirtatious manner.
meanings.sent1: She toyed with him, giving him a sly smile and a playful wink.
meanings.sent2: He toyed with her, gently teasing her about her favorite movie.
meanings.sent3: The friends toyed with each other, laughing and joking around at the party.
meanings.sent4: The actor toyed with the audience, winking and blowing kisses during the performance.
meanings.sent5: The siblings toyed with each other, poking fun but always with love in their hearts.
